title: Edge-Triangle Multiplicity Above Turán
description: Every graph with n vertices and > n²/4 edges contains an edge which is in at least n/6 triangles. Proved by Edwards (unpublished) and Hadziivanov-Nikiforov (1979).

meta.author: Bollobás, Erdős; solved by Edwards, Hadziivanov-Nikiforov

overview.historicalContext: Bollobás and Erdős conjectured this result about edge-triangle multiplicity. It was independently proved by Edwards (unpublished) and Hadziivanov-Nikiforov in 1979. The problem connects to Turán's classical theorem on triangle-free graphs.
overview.problemStatement: Every graph with n vertices and more than n²/4 edges contains an edge which is in at least n/6 triangles.
overview.proofStrategy: The formalization defines a custom Graph structure with symmetric, irreflexive edge sets. It introduces IsTriangle, triangleCountEdge, and maxTriangleMultiplicity. The Turán threshold n²/4 is defined, and the main Bollobás-Erdős conjecture is axiomatized as proved. Tightness of the constant n/6 and connections to Turán theory are included.
keyInsights: n²/4 is the Turán threshold for triangle-free graphs
Exceeding this threshold forces high triangle multiplicity on some edge
The constant n/6 is tight — cannot be improved
The Turán graph T(n,2) achieves the threshold with no triangles
Connects to Problem #80 (general case) and #1034 (stronger version)

sections.title: Part I: Graph Definitions
sections.summary: Defines Graph structure with symmetric irreflexive edge set, edgeCount, and Adj predicate.

sections.title: Part II: Triangles
sections.summary: Defines IsTriangle, triangleCountEdge for a given edge, and maxTriangleMultiplicity over all edges.

sections.title: Part III: Turán's Threshold
sections.summary: Defines turanNumber n = n²/4 and AboveTuran predicate. Axiomatizes Turán's theorem.

sections.title: Part IV: The Main Theorem
sections.summary: Defines BollobasErdosConjecture and axiomatizes it as proved (bollobas_erdos_theorem). Alternate formulation via maxTriangleMultiplicity.

sections.title: Part V: The Constant n/6
sections.summary: Axiomatizes tightness: the constant n/6 cannot be improved in general.

sections.title: Part VI: Connection to Turán Theory
sections.summary: Defines IsTuranGraph (complete bipartite with balanced parts). Axiomatizes triangle-free property and that adding any edge creates triangles.

sections.title: Part VII: Proof Sketch
sections.summary: Placeholder axioms for Edwards' counting approach and Hadziivanov-Nikiforov's Kruskal-Katona approach. Triangle count lower bound lemma.

sections.title: Part VIII: Relation to Problem #80
sections.summary: Placeholder connections to Problem #80 (general case) and Problem #1034 (stronger version).

sections.title: Part IX: Extremal Graphs
sections.summary: Placeholder axioms for extremal graph characterization and near-Turán structure.

sections.title: Part X: Summary
sections.summary: Summary theorem (proved: trivial), erdos_905 := bollobas_erdos_theorem (proved), and historical note.

conclusion.summary: Erdős Problem #905 is SOLVED. Every graph exceeding the Turán threshold n²/4 edges has some edge in at least n/6 triangles. Proved by Edwards (unpublished) and Hadziivanov-Nikiforov (1979).
conclusion.implications: The result shows that exceeding Turán's triangle-free threshold forces not just the existence of triangles, but high edge-triangle multiplicity. This is fundamental to extremal graph theory.
openQuestions: What are the exact extremal graphs for this problem?
How does multiplicity grow as edges exceed n²/4?
What is the answer to the stronger version (Problem #1034)?
